response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21)", "high", "At a young age, individuals may have less maturity and impulse control, leading to a higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Gender (male)", "high", "Males statistically have a higher propensity for criminal recidivism."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Having prior arrest and conviction increases likelihood of future offenses."],
    ["Education (no diploma/GED)", "high", "Lack of formal education is associated with fewer job opportunities and higher risk of reoffending."],
    ["Employment (2 jobs in the year)", "medium", "Some employment history is positive, though limited job stability may indicate economic challenges."],
    ["Social Isolation (living alone, never married)", "medium", "Limited social support can contribute to stress and risk of reoffending."],
    ["Mental Health (periods of depression)", "medium", "Experiencing depressive symptoms can impact decision-making and impulse control."],
    ["Household Size (grew up in large household)", "low", "A larger household in youth may indicate exposure to diverse social interactions, reducing risk."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief in a higher power can be a protective factor, promoting prosocial behavior."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At a young age, individuals may have less maturity and impulse control, leading to a higher risk of recidivism.
Males statistically have a higher propensity for criminal recidivism.
Having prior arrest and conviction increases likelihood of future offenses.
Lack of formal education is associated with fewer job opportunities and higher risk of reoffending.
Some employment history is positive, though limited job stability may indicate economic challenges.
Limited social support can contribute to stress and risk of reoffending.
Experiencing depressive symptoms can impact decision-making and impulse control.
Household Size (grew up in large household)
A larger household in youth may indicate exposure to diverse social interactions, reducing risk.
Belief in a higher power can be a protective factor, promoting prosocial behavior.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 148 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 8. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
